Mothers, above all others, should accustom themselves to thought and investigation. If they will persevere in this 
                                                                           239
course, they will find that they are acquiring the faculty in which they thought themselves deficient, that they are learning to form aright the characters of their children. The result of the labor and thought given to this work will be seen in their obedience, their simplicity, their modesty and purity; and it will richly repay all the effort made.
